meanings.definition: A person who applies a glossy black lacquer to furniture or other objects.
meanings.sent1: The japanner skillfully coated the wooden table with glossy black lacquer.
meanings.sent2: I hired a japanner to give my old dresser a shiny new look.
meanings.sent3: The japanner accidentally spilled the lacquer, turning the floor into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in lacquering furniture earned her the nickname 'The Japanner'.
meanings.sent5: The japanner's hands moved with grace as they transformed the plain chair into a work of art.

meanings.definition: To coat or finish with a glossy black lacquer.
meanings.sent1: She decided to japanner the antique cabinet to restore its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will japanner the new shelves for a sleek finish.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally japannered my hands while trying to fix the lacquer gun.
meanings.sent4: The artist japannered the frame, adding a touch of elegance to the painting.
meanings.sent5: He carefully japannered each piece of the set, ensuring a uniform shine.

meanings.definition: The process or technique of applying a glossy black lacquer.
meanings.sent1: Learning the japanner requires patience and attention to detail.
meanings.sent2: The japanner involves multiple steps to achieve the perfect glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: During the workshop, we tried our hand at the japanner, creating unique designs.
meanings.sent4: The art of japanner has been passed down through generations in their family.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns created through japanner make each piece truly special.
